RelationshipElement.name: CemeteryPlot
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between Cemetery and its Plots

RelationshipElement.name: PlotBurial
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between Plots and its Burials

RelationshipElement.name: PlotPlot
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a N:N between related Plots

RelationshipElement.name: PlotMarker
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between Plots and its Markers

RelationshipElement.name: MarkerMotif
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between Markers and its Motifs

property.name: Site
property.description: Location of the headstone. If in a cemetery, provide name of cemetery here. If an isolated grave, provide a site name.

property.name: Orientation
property.description: Direction person would be facing if they sat up in this grave.

property.name: Lessee
property.description: Name of person who bought the lease.

property.name: Number of burials
property.description: Number of people recorded as being buried in this plot according to primary records.

property.name: Sources
property.description: Primary (archival) sources consulted for this plot.

property.name: Plot type
property.description: Single (single sized grave), Double (two graves side by side in the one plot, e.g. husband/wife), Group (larger than a double sized plot)

lookup.term: {Double}Double (two graves side by side in the one plot, e.g. husband/wife)

property.name: Number of interments
property.description: The number of people buried in this plot as indicated on the markers/monuments.

property.name: Fence height
property.description: Height (cm) of enclosure, measured from bottom to top.

property.name: Other items
property.description: Anything else included as part of the plot for decorative or memorial purposes, e.g. flowers, vases, surface coverings, shrubs, statues etc.

property.name: Form
property.description: The three dimensional shape and size of the marker.

property.name: Shape
property.description: Select shape within each form group. If the marker is not in this list, add an image.

property.name: Plinth height
property.description: Height (cm)of plinth/footing, top to bottom. The plinth is the course in contact with the ground.

property.name: Plinth depth
property.description: Depth (cm) of plinth, front to rear.

property.name: Pedestal height
property.description: Height (cm) of any other courses between the plinth and the marker, top to bottom.

property.name: Headstone height
property.description: Height (cm) of marker, top to bottom.

property.name: Headstone depth
property.description: Depth (cm) of marker, front to rear.

property.name: Headstone width
property.description: Width (cm) of marker, side to side (left to right).

lookup.term: {Engraved}Incised or chiselled into the material of the marker
{Lead}Individual lead letters attached to the marker
{Engraved_and_Painted}Incised into the material with painted letters
{Painted_Only}No incision, letters painted directly on to the marker

property.name: Mason
property.description: Stonemason who made the marker, if indicated on marker.

property.name: Town
property.description: Location of stonemason if indicated on marker.

property.name: Footstone
property.description: A small marker at the foot of the grave, opposite the headstone.

property.name: Inscription
property.description: Record exactly as it reads on the marker, line by line in same spatial order.

lookup.term: {Emotive} Use of emotive words or phrases to describe them or their death.
{Biographical} Details about their life, e.g. where they were born, where they lived, etc
{Factual} No embellishment, use of simple and direct language.
{Religious} e.g. Bible verses, or appeals to God

property.name: Key words
property.description: *Key Wording Introduction: The form of the introductory wording on the marker. *Key Wording Death: The type of metaphor used to refer to death.

lookup.term: {Written_in_first_person}First person (as if the deceased is speaking directly to you – “I”, “Me”)
{Written_in_third_person}Third person (the deceased is being spoken about – “He”, “She”)

property.name: Author
property.description: The person who wrote/chose the epitaph, based on the language or other clues.

lookup.term: {On_marker}Identify all motifs incorporated into the marker/headstone. This includes the shape of the marker and all engraved, painted or applied motifs.
{On_fence_other}Identify all motifs incorporated into the fence or other fittings/furnishings.
